string.text: These ammo parts can be reused for the creation of better variants. This is why some stalkers prefer to keep them around.\n \n
Torn sheets of silk coated paper. Even in a place like the Zone, it can be used for all kind of things. The cheapest way for packaging food.\n \n
A multi-layered, structural material constructed of cotton fabric and thermoreactive tactifying resin.\n \n
Simple cloth sheet, commonly used both to patch clothing and spread oils and cleaning solvents.\n \n
Sheet of military-grade textile. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility. Medium-grade sewing equipment and advanced are glue required for use.\n \n
Thick textile patch reinforced with Kevlar padding. High quality sewing kits and adhesives are required for use.\n \n
A main component in most electrical devices due to its job in rectifying alternative current, storing electrical energy and bypassing noise.\n \n
A box of high-quality BJT transistors that can be used to convert and amplify electrical oscillations.\n \n

Resistors are the most common components found in electronics. They are used to limit and direct the passage of electrical current through circuit branches to ensure other components are getting proper voltage.\n \n

Copper wire is used in many devices to control the transmission or use of electric energy. In its pure form it is rare, but if necessary, can be easily extracted from common old radios, walkie-talkies and other electronics.\n \n

Pieces of wide-grained, light cedar wood. Could be used in crafting.
 
 %c[d_orange] Can be used to craft many items.

Handful of metal bits and pieces of equipment consisting of different types and grades of steel and aluminum alloys.
 
 %c[d_orange] Can be used to craft many items.

Handful of screws, washers, nuts, nails and small pieces of metallic plates in a variety of different types and sizes.
 
 %c[d_orange] Can be used to craft many items.
A small pack made of low density polyethylene film. These thin plastic membranes are used to separate areas or volumes, hold items and act as barriers.\n \n

The trigger mechanism and assembly from an unknown firearm. As most triggers are very similar, this one could be shaved down to fit almost any weapon.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] basic material

A small spring from either the trigger assembly or inner workings of an unknown firearm.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] basic material

Pistol grips from an unknown firearm. This handle could be shaped or molded to fit almost any weapon.
 
 %c[0,255,255,255]PROPERTIES:
 %c[d_cyan] • %c[ui_gray_2] basic material
Barrel from an 18.5mm cock double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Barrel with an integrated silencer from an automatic special purpose 9mm rifle.\n \n
Barrel from a semi-automatic or automatic 7.62mm rifle.\n \n
Barrel from a 7.62mm rifle with a gas regulator.\n \n
Barrel from an automatic special purpose 9mm or PP rifle.\n \n
Barrel from the infamous or even legendary PPSh submachine gun system.\n \n
Double-mode Hammer Type Trigger. Designed for use in both automatic and single fire modes.\n \n
Triple-fire mode Hammer Type Trigger. Designed for use in automatic, single and double fire modes. Strongly tied to the design of the weapon.\n \n
Single-fire Mode Trigger Mechanism with Firing Pin (Trigger)
Single-fire mode trigger mechanism with firing pin.\n \n
Double-fire Mode Trigger Mechanism with Firing Pin (Trigger)
Double-fire mode trigger mechanism with firing pin. Allows shooting in single and automatic fire modes.\n \n
Trigger mechanism with hammer from a double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Sliding Bolt Carrier with Turning Bolt Lock [R] (Carrier)
Sliding bolt carrier with a turning bolt lock, produced by Eastern manufacturers.\n \n
Sliding Bolt Carrier with Turning Bolt Lock [R] (Carrier)
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock, produced by Eastern manufacturers, from special automatic weapons.\n \n
Sliding Bolt Carrier with Turning Bolt Lock [NATO] (Carrier)
Longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn, produced by NATO, from a standard caliber automatic rifle.\n \n
Sliding Bolt Carrier with a Locking Bias (Carrier)
Sliding bolt carrier with a locking bias.\n \n
Half-free sliding bolt carrier with a roller brake.\n \n
Sliding Bolt Carrier with Locking Bolt (Carrier)
Sliding bolt carrier with locking bolt.\n \n
Lever-type Bolt Carrier with Locking Wedge (Carrier)
Lever type bolt carrier with locking wedge.\n \n
Sliding Bolt Carrier with Turning Bolt Lock [NATO] (Carrier)
Sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock; product of NATO countries, for a large-caliber automatic rifle.\n \n
Sliding free bolt carrier from a submachine gun.\n \n
Dropping-block breech from a smooth-bore shotgun or rifle with lever locking mechanism. In appearance, the ledges of the wedge are in good condition, without strong workings\n \n
Rotating locking head with two stops from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn. In appearance, locking heads are in good condition, without big signs of usage.\n \n
Rotating locking head with two stops from either automatic or semi-automatic smoothbore rifle, with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head with two stops from a rifle with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with a locking bias and a longitudinally-sliding shutter with a "bolt" lock.\n \n
Rotating locking head with two stops from a rifle with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head with two stops from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head with four locks from a special automatic rifle with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head with six locks from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head with seven locks from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Rotating locking head with eight locks from a machine gun with a longitudinally-sliding breech block with lock turn.\n \n
Supercharger with Hammer from a Double-barrel Shotgun [R] (Bolt)
Right and left supercharger with hammer from a double-barrel shotgun.\n \n
Hammers from a Hammer-type Double-barrel Shotgun [R] (Bolt)
Right and left hammers from the double-barrelled horizontal shotgun.\n \n
Rotating locking head with two stops from a large-caliber automatic rifle produced by NATO countries, with a sliding bolt carrier with turning bolt lock.\n \n
Rotating locking head from either the PP or an automatic rifle with a longitudinal, half-free sliding bolt carrier.\n \n
Drummer with the mainspring from some domestic PP with a longitudinal sliding-free bolt carrier.\n \n
Drummer with the mainspring from some imported PP with a longitudinal, sliding-free bolt carrier.\n \n
Drummer with the mainspring from some Soviet PP, like the PP of Shpagin’s system with a longitudinal, sliding-free bolt carrier.\n \n
Gas tube from a smoothbore carbine.\n \n
mobile hand guard from pump-action shotgun.\n \n
Gas tube from a self-loading rifle.\n \n
Gas tube from a special automatic rifle. 9mm.\n \n
Gas tube from a semi-automatic or automatic rifle (Russia).\n \n
Gas tube from a semi-automatic or automatic rifle (NATO).\n \n
Gas tube from a machine gun.\n \n
Ejector from a rifle with a sliding bolt carrier with locking bolt.\n \n
Ejector from Over-under Double-barrel Shotgun [R] (Gas Tube)
Ejector (extractor) from an over-under double barrel shotgun.\n \n
Ejector from Over-under Double-barrel Shotgun [R] (Gas Tube)
Ejector from an over-under double barrel shotgun.\n \n
Gas tube from the MP5 submachine gun with a handle.\n \n
The very base of an outfit. These sheets are made of different materials such as cotton, polycotton, wool and leather to provide comfort and durability.\n \n
The very base of an outfit. These textiles are blended with synthetic materials such as polyester and lycra to provide versatility and durability.\n \n
These sheets are made of different materials such as polyester, leather and canvas. Good durability in harsh environmental conditions.\n \n
Sheets of military-grade textiles. Protective fabrics are used like rubber and ballistic nylon, along with joint protections. Valued for its relatively low price and high versatility.\n \n
Textiles that are more resistant to fire through chemical treatment or manufactured fireproof fibers.\n \n
Textiles that are more resistant to electric shock and chemical particles through chemical treatment or manufactured fibers.\n \n
Rigid Polyvinyl Chloride (RPVC) is a non-flammable material that is resistant to weathering. RPVC can also be UV stabilized to provide higher protection against anomalous hazards.\n \n
Rigid Polyvinyl Chloride (RPVC) is a non-flammable material that is resistant to weathering. RPVC can also be UV stabilized to provide higher protection against anomalous hazards.\n \n
A tough and durable PVC coated polyester and rubber-fiber fabric designed for use in providing protection against hazards.\n \n
A tough and durable PVC coated polyester and carbon-fiber fabric designed for use in providing protection against hazards.\n \n
This magnesium grid acts as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and its wearer from powerful electric shocks and psi-waves. It can also offer protection against other hazards.\n \n
This magnesium grid acts as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and it's wearer from powerful electric shocks and psi-waves. It can also offer protection against other hazards.\n \n
The thermal degradation behaviour of bismuth-sulfate makes it a great choice for outfits used inside the Zone as it can provide protection against environmental hazards.\n \n
The thermal degradation behaviour of barium-sulfate makes it a great choice for outfits used inside the Zone as it can provide protection against environmental hazards.\n \n

Multi-layer Aluminized fabrics are specifically designed for protective apparel and shields used in environments that pose serious fire or safety risks associated with radiant heat and chemical sources. In addition, these fabrics offer great isolation against psi-waves.\n \n

Multi-layer Aluminized fiberglass fabrics are specifically designed for protective apparel and shields used in environments that pose serious shock or safety risks associated with radiant heat and chemical sources. In addition, these fabrics offer great isolation against psi-waves effects.\n \n
PBI-blended fabrics have been recognized and trusted in the fire service over the years as the leading high-performance protective fire resistant fabrics.\n \n
PBI-blended fabrics have been recognized and trusted in the fire service over the years as the leading high-performance protective fire resistant fabrics.\n \n

Originally developed for use in chemical warfare suits, Activated Carbon Cloth has many relevant uses in defense, industrial, and medical applications. It considerably enhances the efficacy of both advanced and active wound dressings, along with providing great protection from radiation particles.\n \n

Originally developed for use in chemical warfare suits. Activated Carbon Cloth has many relevant uses in defense, industrial, and medical applications. It considerably enhances the efficacy of both advanced and active wound dressings, along with providing great protection from radiation particles.\n \n
Inserts made of constantan sheets acting as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and its wearer from electric shocks, psi-waves and radioactive materials.\n \n
Insulating Constantan Inserts w/ Fiberglass Coating
Inserts made of constantan sheets and fiberglass-coated fabrics acting as dielectric layers to protect the outfit and its wearer from electric shocks, psi-waves and radioactive materials.\n \n

High temperature resistant fabrics woven from “E" glass fibers and coated with a Vermiculite based film providing extended service temperatures up to 1500°F and good shock resistance up to 20Kv. In a place like the Zone, these fabrics can come in handy against anomalous hazards.\n \n

High temperature resistant fabrics woven from “E" glass fibers and coated with a Vermiculite based film providing extended service temperatures up to 1700°F and good shock resistance up to 25Kv. In a place like the Zone, these fabrics can come in handy against anomalous hazards.\n \n
Kevlar K129 Plates w/ Reinforced Ceramic Inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with ceramic inserts.\n \n
Kevlar Protera Plates w/ Reinforced Ceramic Inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with Protera plates.\n \n
Kevlar K129 Plates w/ Polycarbonate Composite

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with a polycarbonate composite.\n \n
Kevlar K129 Plates w/ Carbon-fiber Composite

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with a carbon-fiber composite.\n \n

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with a carbon-fiber composite.\n \n
Kevlar AP Plates w/ Reinforced Titanium Composite

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with additional titanium composite.\n \n
Kevlar K119 Plates w/ Polycarbonate Inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with polycarbonate inserts.\n \n
Kevlar K119 Plates w/ Carbon-fiber Inserts

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been reinforced with carbon-fiber inserts.\n \n
Grade-B Polyethylene Plates w/ Expanded Carrier

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun rounds and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use.\n \n
Grade-A Polyethylene Plates w/ Expanded Carrier

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun rounds and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use.\n \n

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts.\n \n

Kevlar plates are widely known for their protective capabilities, absorbing the impact of firearm projectiles with moderate ease. They constitute a lightweight alternative to heavy steel inserts. These have been further reinforced with additional Kevlar.\n \n

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun rounds and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use.\n \n

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun rounds and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use. These have been put together within the Zone using a variety of used and worn pieces.\n \n
Carbon Nanotube Layers w/ Kevlar-49 Fabrics

Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) have great potential as a ballistic-resistant material. The remarkable properties of CNTs makes them an ideal candidate for reinforcing polymers and other materials and is often used in applications such as bullet-proof vests. These are reinforced with Kevlar-49 fabrics.\n \n
Carbon Nanotube Layers w/ Kevlar-29 Fabrics (Reinforced)

Carbon nanotubes (CNTs) have great potential as a ballistic-resistant material. The remarkable properties of CNTs makes them an ideal candidate for reinforcing polymers and other materials and is often used in applications such as bullet-proof vests. These are reinforced with Kevlar-29 fabrics.\n \n
Polyethylene Fiber Layers w/ Polycarbonate Inserts

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun rounds and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use. These have been reinforced with polycarbonate inserts.\n \n

Polyethylene plates that provide extra protection to vital areas. These hard armor plates have proven effective against all handgun rounds and a range of rifles. These upgraded ballistic vests have become standard in military use. These have been reinforced with polycarbonate inserts.\n \n
Carbon-fiber is light weight, flexible and is able to withstand high temperatures.\n \n
Carbon-fiber is light weight, flexible and is able to withstand high temperatures. These have been further reinforced with additional layers.\n \n
Mechanical frame powered by a system of electric motors, pneumatics, levers and hydraulics that give the wearer both superior protection as well as greatly increased physical strength.\n \n
